author: Joanna Sugden
title: U.K. Looks to Slow Down Pace of Gambling Addicts’ Losses
text:
LONDON—The U.K. government set out plans to sharply cut the maximum stake in fixed-odds betting terminals in an effort to wean addicts off electronic gaming machines that allow gamblers to bet repeatedly at speed.
The maximum stake will be cut to £2 from £100 ($2.70 from $135), said Tracey Crouch, minister for sport and civil society, in announcement to lawmakers on Thursday.
